content.rendered:
What We Do
From supporting STEM in high schools and colleges, through R&D work for the government. We help companies provide safe transportation from city to city, or countries, or to the stars. Inventors, Startups and Partners work with us, to connect the dots and make their ideas fly.
Learn More
Engineering services
From Design through Certification, we can help your team with Engineering Services and Software to help reach your goals.
Learn More
Software & Automation
Our software can help you reduce the time and costs associated with the design, analysis and optimization of high performance systems and structures found in aerospace, automotive, construction, theme park attractions, and energy production.
Learn More
Previous
Next
Latest News
Thermal-Structural Analysis of PCB in Simcenter 3D
Shear Moment Diagram of a Blended Wing Body using pyNastran
July 2021 Newsletter
April 2021 Newsletter

how we can help you

Design

Design

Approximately 70 percent of the cost of a design is spent in the first 30 percent of the design cycle. The choices you make and ideas you generate will constrain what you can do later.
Click Here

Analysis

Analysis

Companies that have used simulation software for product development have reported up to a 60 percent reduction in design cycle time (from 20 weeks to 8) and a 40 percent improvement to overall design costs.
Click Here

Optimization

Optimization

Doing the most with the least is one way to look at optimization. Creating the best solution with the time and resources available to you is another.
Click Here

Manufacturing

Manufacturing

From Prototypes through full production, we can help you fabricate your metallic, composite, or electronic components.
Click Here

Testing

Testing

From coupon fabrication and allowables development through test planning and fixture design, we can support your test requirements.
Click Here

Electric airplanes to eVTOL

Today’s aerospace industry is going through incredible innovation and development of new technologies and transportation concepts. It is an exciting time to be part of this adventure.  As new companies emerge and “old” companies reinvent themselves, they may need some help in getting their ideas off the ground. This is where we might be able to help you, as we are helping others with their projects. So whether you have a flying car, an air taxi, or a UAV/Drone, please contact us to see how we might be able to help.

Learn More

Commercial launch and Supersonic travel

It’s amazing how the aerospace landscape is changing. Not just in numbers of companies, but also in the range, speed and missions being addressed. New companies are creating better and more cost effective ways to launch satellites and reach to the stars, while others are figuring out how to get you from point A to Point B at the highest speed and the greatest efficiency. We are helping many of them explore this new space. Please reach out to us to see how we might be able to help launch your concept.

Learn More

Our Clients

U.S. Air Force
The United States Air Force (USAF) is the aerial warfare service branch of the United States Armed Forces and one of the seven American uniformed services.
GE Aviation
GE Aviation is among the top aircraft engine suppliers, and offers engines for the majority of commercial aircraft. GE Aviation is part of the General Electric conglomerate, which is one of the world’s largest corporations.
Uber
Uber’s Elevate program is creating urban aerial ridesharing, globally. Starting in 2023, Uber customers will be able to push a button and get a flight on-demand with uberAIR in Dallas, Los Angeles, and a third international market.
US Navy
The United States Navy (USN) is the naval warfare service branch of the United States Armed Forces and one of the seven uniformed services of the United States. It is the largest navy in the world, with a battle fleet tonnage that is greater than that of the next 13 largest navies combined.
Jacobs Engineering
Jacobs Engineering is an international engineering, architecture, and construction firm with offices located around the world. As a publicly traded company with 60,000 employees and 2011 revenues of more than $10 billion, Jacobs offers support to industrial, commercial, and government clients.
NASA
The National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) is the agency of the United States government that is responsible for the nation’s civilian space program and for aeronautics and aerospace research.
Northrop Grumman
Northrop Grumman Corporation (NYSE: NOC) is an American global aerospace and defense technology company formed by the 1994 purchase of Grumman by Northrop. The company was the fourth-largest defense contractor in the world as of 2010.
Previous
Next

Latest News & Updates

M4 Engineering
  • Thermal-Structural Analysis of PCB in Simcenter 3D February 14, 2022
    Learn how to perform a thermal-structural analysis in Simcenter 3D. Take advantage of Simcenter multidisciplinary capabilities to greatly simplify the workflow for PCB analysis. Challenges: PCB warpage under thermal loads Thermal-structural analysis typically requires different tools/environments to be used Learning curve prevents engineers from mastering different environments Values: Single environment (CAD-thermal-structures) simplifies learning curve Integrated […]
  • Shear Moment Diagram of a Blended Wing Body using pyNastran July 14, 2021
    If we want to make a shear/moment diagram using FEMAP, we need to make repeated Interface Load resultants.  This can be tedious, but is an option.  Alternatively, this can be created using pyNastran.  PyNastran enables analysts using Nastran to efficiently create, manipulate, and extract data from models.  It handles the underlying details so you get […]
